info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 2:56PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 256 PM MST /356 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southeast of Bill Williams Mountain, or 27 miles northwest of Sedona, moving northeast at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Williams, Sherwood Forest Estates, Scholz Lake, Sycamore Falls, Garland Prairie, Whitehorse Lake, Kaibab Lake, Parks, Bill Williams Mountain, J.D. Dam Lake, Government Prairie, Red Lake, Camp Navajo, Bellemont, Rogers Lake, Howard Mesa, Flagstaff Ranch, Maine, H A Clark Memorial Field and Sycamore Canyon Wilderness.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 158 and 190. Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 163 and 165. State Route 64 between mile markers 186 and 200.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... White Horse Lake Campground, Camp Raymond, Dogtown Lake Campground, Kaibab Lake Campground and Bill Williams Campground.
This includes the following swimming holes... Sycamore Falls, Lower Sycamore Falls "The Golden Pond" and Paradise Forks.
info.instruction: Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT COCONINO COUNTY UNTIL 330 PM MST /430 PM MDT/

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons
